body_html:
Hi, @edgimar .
I am not clear which one you need:

  1. an solution to handle other image format,
  2. or, a new parse ops tf.decode_tiff (tf.decode_image is just a wrapper outside) .

For the first one: In fact, Tensor supports arbitrary dimensions. So if TIFF or any format desired can be converted to array by Python, we are free to feed them into TensorFlow.

For the second one, perhaps the work will be difficult. And moreover, since most operators of tf.image seems designed for 3d / 4d nowadays, I don't know whether they are compatible if done.

Anyway, it is cool if someone wants to implement this.

For the second one, perhaps the work will be difficult. And moreover, since most operators of tf.image seems designed for 3d / 4d nowadays, I don't know whether they are compatible if done.
Anyway, it is cool if someone wants to implement this.
body:
Hi, @edgimar .
I am not clear which one you need:
1. an solution to handle other image format,
2. or, a new parse ops `tf.decode_tiff` (`tf.decode_image` is just a wrapper outside) .

For the first one: In fact, `Tensor` supports arbitrary dimensions. So if TIFF or any format desired can be converted to array by Python, we are free to feed them into TensorFlow.

For the second one, perhaps the work will be difficult. And moreover, since most operators of `tf.image` seems designed for 3d / 4d nowadays, I don't know whether they are compatible if done.

Anyway, it is cool if someone wants to implement this.
